definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.chinese: 走好运与倒霉交替发生。

sentences.english: Then it was time for my fortunes to take an upward swing again.
sentences.chinese: 现在该是我又走好运的时候了。

definition: the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
one of the twelve animals symbolic of the earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1]/animal from the Chinese zodiac
luck with the ladies/a romance/good luck
lucky star in the ascendant (idiom); a lucky sign
